text: 可動電圧 臨界点まであと0.5 0.2 突破 / 軌道システム 第二段階へ行こう / パイロット接合に入ります / システムフェーズ2 スタート
translation: Operating voltage, 0.5 to critical point, 0.2, breakthrough / Orbital system, proceeding to second stage / Entering pilot connection / System phase 2, start
grammar: Use of まであと + number to indicate distance remaining to a target. Volitional form 行こう (let's go) used for suggesting action.

text: シナプス挿入 結合開始 / パルス送信 / 全回路正常 / 初期コンタクト 異常なし / 左右上腕筋まで 動力伝達
translation: Synapse insertion, beginning connection / Pulse transmission / All circuits normal / Initial contact, no abnormalities / Power transmission to left and right upper arm muscles
grammar: Technical report-style short phrases without particles. Use of まで to indicate extent (up to the muscles).

text: ウォルナーブリンク 問題なし / チェック2550までリストクリア
translation: Warner blink, no problems / List clear up to check 2550
grammar: Technical jargon with English loanwords. まで indicating extent up to a certain point.

text: ランサー接続時2550までクリア / 絶対境界線まであと0.9、0.7、0.5、0.4、0.13
translation: Lancer connection clear up to 2550 / 0.9, 0.7, 0.5, 0.4, 0.13 remaining to absolute borderline
grammar: まであと pattern repeatedly used to indicate distance/amount remaining to target.

text: パルス逆流!
translation: Pulse backflow!
grammar: Exclamatory sentence indicating urgent situation.

text: 第3ステージに異常発生!中枢神経阻止にも拒絶が始まっています!
translation: Abnormality occurring in stage 3! Rejection has also begun in central nervous system blocking!
grammar: ています form indicating ongoing action. にも particle showing addition (also/even).

text: コンタクト停止!6番までの回路を開いて / 信号が届きません!
translation: Stop contact! Open the circuits up to number 6 / The signal isn't reaching!
grammar: Te-form command 開いて (open). Negative polite ません indicating the signal is not reaching.

text: 0号機!制御不能! / 実験中止。電源を落とせ! / はい!
translation: Unit 0! Out of control! / Abort the experiment. Cut the power! / Yes!
grammar: Command form 落とせ (imperative of 落とす). 不能 suffix indicating inability.

text: 0号機、予備電源に切り替わりました / 完全停止まであと35秒
translation: Unit 0 has switched to backup power / 35 seconds remaining until complete shutdown
grammar: ました past polite form. まであと pattern indicating time remaining.

text: 危険です、下がってください
translation: It's dangerous, please step back
grammar: Polite request using てください (please do).

text: オートエイジャクション、作動します / いかん!
translation: Auto-ejection, activating / This is bad!
grammar: します indicating imminent action. いかん is an emphatic/stern expression of something being wrong.

text: 完全停止まで、特殊ベークライト、急いで! / 8、7、6、5、
translation: Until complete shutdown, special bakelite, hurry! / 8, 7, 6, 5,
grammar: Te-form command 急いで (hurry). まで indicating time limit.
Simple countdown sequence.

text: レイ、大丈夫か?
translation: Rei, are you okay?
grammar: Informal question with か particle.

text: そうか
translation: I see
grammar: Acknowledgment expression, informal form of そうですか.

text: 過去の経歴は白紙、全て抹消済み / で、さきの実験の事故原因はどうだったの? / 未だ不明
translation: Past history is blank, everything has been erased / So, what about the cause of the accident in the earlier experiment? / Still unknown
grammar: 済み suffix indicating completion. 未だ (still, yet) with 不明 (unknown).

text: ただし、推定では操縦者の精神的不安定が第一原因と考えられるわ
translation: However, in our estimation, the pilot's mental instability is believed to be the primary cause
grammar: と考えられる passive form meaning 'is believed/thought to be'. わ sentence-ending particle for feminine speech.

text: 精神的に不安定?あのレインが? / ええ、彼女にしては信じられないくらい乱れたね / 何があったの? / わからないわ
translation: Mentally unstable? That Rei? / Yes, it was unbelievably disturbed for her / What happened? / I don't know

vocabulary.meaning: to be disturbed, to be disordered

grammar: にしては expressing 'for her' or 'considering it's her'. くらい indicating degree/extent.

text: でも、まさか… / なんか心当たりがあるの? / いえ、そんなはずはないわ
translation: But, it couldn't be... / Do you have any idea? / No, that can't be

vocabulary.meaning: idea, clue, something coming to mind

grammar: はずはない expressing 'cannot be' or 'shouldn't be'. なんか casual form of なにか.

text: D3ブロックの解体終了 / 全データを技術局一課分析班に提出してください
translation: D3 block dismantling complete / Please submit all data to Technical Bureau Section 1 Analysis Team
grammar: てください polite request form.

text: これは僕たちの敵なのか
translation: Is this our enemy?
grammar: のか question marker expressing contemplation/wondering.

text: なるほどね / コア以外はほとんど原型をとどめているわ
translation: I see / Aside from the core, it's retained almost all of its original form
grammar: ている form indicating state. 以外 meaning 'except for'.

text: ほんと理想的なサンプル / ありがたいわ
translation: Really an ideal sample / I'm grateful
grammar: 的 suffix making noun into adjective. わ feminine sentence-ending particle.

text: で何かわかったわけ
translation: So did you figure anything out?
grammar: わけ sentence-ending particle used to seek explanation or confirmation.

text: 何これ / 解析不能を示すコードナンバー
translation: What's this? / A code number indicating analysis impossible.
grammar: を示す - particle を + verb 示す (to show/indicate) creates 'indicating/showing X' pattern

text: つまりわけわかんないってこと / そう 使徒は粒子と波 両方の性質を備える光のようなもので構成されているのよ
translation: In other words, we don't understand it at all. / Right. The Angel is composed of something like light that has properties of both particles and waves.
grammar: わけわかんない - casual contraction of わけがわからない (doesn't make sense). ～ている - continuous/state form indicating ongoing condition

text: で 動力源はあったんでしょ / らしきものはね でもその作動原理がまださっぱりなのよ / まだまだ未知の世界が広がってるわけね
translation: So there was a power source, right? / Something like that, yes. But we still have no idea about its operating principle. / So there's still a vast unknown world ahead of us.
grammar: ～んでしょ - casual form of ～のでしょう (right?/isn't it?). さっぱり with の indicates 'completely unknown/unclear'

text: とかくこの世は謎だらけよ / 例えば ほら この使徒独自の固有波形パターン
translation: In any case, this world is full of mysteries. / For example, look, this unique waveform pattern of the Angel.
grammar: ～だらけ - suffix meaning 'full of, covered with' (often negative connotation)

text: どれどれ
translation: Let me see.
grammar: Repetition of question word どれ for casual exclamatory effect

text: これって / そう / 構成素材の違いはあっても / 信号の配置と座標は / 人間の遺伝子と酷似しているわ / 99.89%ね
translation: This is... / That's right. / Even though the constituent materials differ, / the signal arrangement and coordinates / are remarkably similar to human genes. / 99.89%.
grammar: ～あっても - 'even though/if' concessive form of ～ある

text: 99.89%って / 改めて私たちの知恵の / 浅はかさってものを / 思い知らせてくれるわ
translation: 99.89%... / It really makes us realize / the shallowness / of our wisdom.
grammar: ～ってもの - colloquial particle emphasizing the noun. ～てくれる - doing something (for us), benefactive auxiliary

text: これがコアか / 残りはどうだ / それが劣化が激しく資料としては問題が多すぎます / 構わん / 他はすべて破棄だ / はい
translation: So this is the core. / What about the rest? / Well, the deterioration is severe and there are too many problems to use it as research material. / I don't care. / Dispose of everything else. / Yes, sir.

vocabulary.meaning: I don't care, it doesn't matter

grammar: それが - 'well, the thing is...' expressing hesitation or explanation. ～としては - 'as/in terms of'

text: どうしたの? / あ、あ、いえ、別に
translation: What's wrong? / Oh, uh, nothing.
grammar: どうしたの - casual question form. 別に (with implicit negative) = 'nothing in particular'

text: あのね、そういう顔して別にって言われてもね / 気にかけてください、心配してくださいって言われてるようなもんなんですけどね
translation: Look, when you make that face and say 'nothing'... / It's as if you're saying 'Please worry about me, please be concerned,' you know.
grammar: ～て言われても - 'even if you say...'. ～ようなもの - 'like/as if', expressing similarity

text: あの、お父さん手に火傷してるみたいなんだけど / 火傷?
translation: Um, it looks like your father has a burn on his hand. / A burn?
grammar: ～てるみたいなんだけど - 'it seems that..., but...' combining ている + みたい + なんだけど

text: どうしたのかなって思って / 火傷って知ってる?
translation: I was wondering what happened. / Do you know about the burn?
grammar: ～のかなって思って - 'I was thinking/wondering...' quotative って with 思う

text: あなたがまだここに来る前 / 起動実験中に0号機が暴走したの / 聞いてるでしょ / はい
translation: Before you came here / Unit-00 went berserk during an activation test. / You've heard about it, right? / Yes.
grammar: ～でしょ - casual form of ～でしょう, seeking confirmation

text: その時パイロットが中に閉じ込められてね
translation: At that time, the pilot was trapped inside.
grammar: ～られてね - passive form ～られる + casual particle ね for explanation

text: パイロットって綾波ですよね / 怒り司令が彼女を助け出したの
translation: The pilot was Ayanami, right? / Commander Ikari rescued her.
grammar: ～って - casual quotative/topic marker. ～出す - compound verb suffix indicating 'doing completely/thoroughly'

text: 加熱したハッチを無理やりこじ開けてね
translation: He forcibly pried open the heated hatch.
grammar: 無理やり - adverb meaning 'forcibly/by force'

text: 父さんが手のひらのやけどはその時のものよ。
translation: Your father's palm burn is from that time.
grammar: ～のもの - 'the one from...' possessive pattern

text: 何か鈴原って目つ / きやらしい。
translation: Somehow Suzuhara's eyes look / lecherous.
grammar: 何か～って - 'somehow...' using 何か for vague feeling and って for casual quotation

text: どうしてあいついつも一人なんだろうって思ってさ / え?ああ? / ああ、まあ、そない言うたら
translation: I was thinking, why is she always alone? / Eh? Huh? / Ah, well, now that you mention it...
grammar: ～だろうって思って - 'I was thinking that...' quotative って with 思う. Kansai dialect forms そない言うたら

text: 一年の時転校してきたからずっと友達いてないな / なんとなく近寄りがたいんだよ
translation: She transferred in during first year, so she hasn't had friends since then. / Somehow it's hard to approach her.
grammar: ～がたい - 'hard to/difficult to' suffix attached to verb stems. いてない - Kansai dialect negative of いる

text: ほんま性格悪 / いんとちゃうか?
translation: Really bad personality / isn't it?
grammar: Kansai dialect: ほんま (本当), ちゃうか (じゃないか)

text: エヴァのパイロット同士だろ? / シンジが一番よく知ってるんじゃないの? / そりゃそうや
translation: You're both Eva pilots, right? / Shinji would know her best, wouldn't he? / That's true.
grammar: ～だろ - casual masculine form of だろう. ～んじゃないの - negative question 'wouldn't/doesn't...?'

text: ほ、ほとんど口… / 聞かないか
translation: We ha-hardly speak... / Don't you?
grammar: 口を聞く - idiomatic expression 'to speak/talk with someone'

text: CBL循環を開始 / 排液は第二浄水システムへ / 各タンパク壁の状態は良好 / 各部問題なし
translation: Commencing CBL circulation. / Waste fluid to secondary purification system. / All protein wall conditions good. / All sections, no problems.
grammar: Technical/military style speech with noun + を + verb patterns for commands/reports

text: プロ号機の再起動実験までマイナス1050分です
translation: It's minus 1050 minutes until the Unit-00 restart experiment.
grammar: までマイナス〜分です - 'minus X minutes until' is a countdown expression used in technical/military contexts

text: 何よこれ / カレーよ
translation: What is this? / It's curry.
grammar: 〜よ - feminine sentence-ending particle for emphasis or assertion

text: 相変わらずインスタントな食事ね / お呼ばれされといて文句を言わない
translation: Instant food as always, huh? / Don't complain when you've been invited over.
grammar: 〜といて - colloquial contraction of 〜ておいて, meaning 'while/despite doing'

text: みさとさんは? / 私はね、じゃーん!
translation: What about you, Misato-san? / For me, ta-da!
grammar: 〜は? - topic marker with rising intonation for asking 'what about...?'

text: ここに入れちゃって、とばーっと! / 本気ですか? / いやーね、いけるのよ!
translation: I just put it in here, and whoosh! / Are you serious? / Come on, it works!
grammar: 〜ちゃって - colloquial form of 〜てしまって, expressing completion with casual/light tone; とばーっと - onomatopoeia

text: じゃあ、最初からカレー味のカップ麺じゃね、この味は出ないのよ!
translation: Look, you can't get this flavor with curry-flavored cup noodles from the start!

vocabulary.meaning: to come out, to be produced

grammar: 〜じゃ - contraction of では in casual speech; 〜のよ - feminine explanatory particle

text: いただきます! / スープとお湯を少なめにしとくのがコツよ!
translation: Let's eat! / The trick is to use less soup and hot water!

vocabulary.meaning: on the small side, less than usual

grammar: 〜しとく - contraction of 〜しておく, meaning 'to do in advance/preparation'

text: これ作ったのミサトね / わかる?
translation: Misato made this, didn't she? / Can you tell?
grammar: 〜の - nominalizer turning the clause into a noun phrase; casual word order omitting copula だ

text: 味でね / レトルトを減量によくここまで / 今度呼んでいただけるときは / シンジ君が当番のときにしていただけるかしら
translation: By the taste. / To reduce a retort pack this much... / Next time you invite me, could you make it when Shinji-kun is on cooking duty?
grammar: 〜していただけるかしら - feminine polite request form combining てもらえる (receiving favor) + かしら (wondering)

text: シンジ君やっぱり引っ越しなさい / ガサツな同居人の影響で一生台無しにすることないわよ / もう慣れましたから
translation: Shinji-kun, you really should move out. / You don't need to ruin your life under the influence of a crude roommate. / I'm already used to it.
grammar: 〜なさい - gentle imperative form; 〜することない - 'no need to do'; 〜わよ - feminine assertive particle

text: そうよ、リツコ。人間の環境適応能力を侮ってはいけないわ。
translation: That's right, Ritsuko. You shouldn't underestimate human adaptability to the environment.

vocabulary.meaning: to underestimate, to look down on

grammar: 〜てはいけない - must not, should not (prohibition); 〜わ - feminine sentence-ending particle

text: だいたい引っ越すったって。 / あら、シンちゃん、もう一歩お願い。 / はい。
translation: Besides, even if he were to move... / Oh, Shin-chan, one more step please. / Yes.
grammar: 〜ったって - colloquial form of 〜と言っても, meaning 'even if/though one says'

text: 手続き面倒よ。シンジ君、本ちゃんのセキュリティカードもらったばかりなんだもの。 / あ、忘れるとこだったわ。シンジ君、頼みがあるの。 / 何ですか? / 綾波レイの更新カード。
translation: The paperwork is a hassle. Shinji-kun just got his official security card. / Oh, I almost forgot. Shinji-kun, I have a favor to ask. / What is it? / Rei Ayanami's updated card.
grammar: 〜たばかり - just did; 〜とこだった - was about to; 〜んだもの - explanatory particle with emphasis

text: 私そびれたままになってて / 悪いんだけど / 本部に行く前に彼女のところへ / 届けてもらえないかしら / はい
translation: I've left it undone. / Sorry, but could you deliver it to her place before going to headquarters? / Yes.

vocabulary.meaning: to miss the chance to do

grammar: 〜そびれる - to miss the opportunity to do; 〜たまま - remain in a state; 〜てもらえないかしら - feminine polite request

text: どうしちゃったの / レイの写真をじーっと見ちゃったりして / あ、いや / ひょっとしてシンちゃん / 違うよ / またまた照れちゃったりしてさ
translation: What's gotten into you? / You were staring intently at Rei's photo. / Ah, no... / Could it be, Shin-chan? / No way! / There you go getting embarrassed again.

vocabulary.meaning: to be embarrassed, to be shy

grammar: 〜ちゃう - colloquial form of 〜てしまう; 〜たりして - doing things like; またまた - 'there you go again'

text: レイの家に行くオフィシャルな口実ができてチャンスじゃない
translation: You've got an official excuse to go to Rei's house - it's a chance, isn't it?
grammar: 〜じゃない - casual form meaning 'isn't it?' (seeking agreement)

text: からかわないでやもう
translation: Don't tease me already!

vocabulary.meaning: to tease, to make fun of

grammar: 〜ないで - negative te-form meaning 'don't do'; や - Kansai dialect emphatic particle

text: すぐムキになってからかいがいのありやつ / ミサトと同じね
translation: He gets worked up so easily - he's worth teasing. / Just like Misato.

vocabulary.meaning: to get worked up, to get serious

grammar: 〜がいのある - worth doing; すぐ - immediately, easily

text: 僕はただ同じエヴァのパイロットなのに / アヤナミのことよくわからなくて / いい子よとても / あなたのお父さんに似て / とても不器用だけど
translation: It's just that we're both Eva pilots, but I don't really understand Ayanami. / She's a good girl, very much so. Like your father, she's very awkward.
grammar: 〜のに - despite, although; 〜に似て - resembling, similar to

text: 不器用って何がですか
translation: What do you mean by awkward?
grammar: 〜って - quotative particle used for clarification; 何が - 'what (is it that)'

text: 生きることが
translation: Living.
grammar: 〜ことが - nominalizer turning the verb into a noun; sentence fragment for emphasis

text: ごめんください
translation: Excuse me! (Is anyone home?)

vocabulary.meaning: polite greeting when visiting someone's home

grammar: ごめんください - fixed expression used when visiting someone's home, literally 'please forgive (my intrusion)'

text: ごめんください / 怒りだけど
translation: Excuse me! / It's Ikari, but...
grammar: 〜だけど - but, however (sentence-ending particle showing hesitation)

text: あやなみ入るよ
translation: Ayanami, I'm coming in.
grammar: 〜よ - sentence-ending particle for assertion/warning; using non-past tense for imminent action

text: アヤナミノかな?
translation: I wonder if this is Ayanami's?
grammar: の is a possessive particle; かな expresses uncertainty or wondering

text: ああああああ
translation: Ahhhhhhh!

vocabulary.meaning: ah, oh (exclamation of surprise or shock)

grammar: Extended exclamation expressing shock or surprise

text: どいてくれる
translation: Will you get out of the way?

vocabulary.meaning: to move aside, to get out of the way

grammar: Te-form + くれる indicates a request for someone to do something (for the speaker's benefit)

text: あの
translation: Um...

vocabulary.meaning: um, excuse me (filler word to get attention)

grammar: Hesitation marker used to get someone's attention politely

text: 何?
translation: What?
grammar: Simple interrogative

text: いや僕は / その
grammar: Stuttering speech pattern showing nervousness

text: 僕は頼まれて
translation: I was asked to...
grammar: Passive form (頼まれて) indicates being asked by someone; te-form leaves sentence incomplete, trailing off

text: つまりなんだっけ / カードカード新しくなったから / 届けてくれ
translation: I mean, what was it again? / The card, the card was updated, so / I was told to deliver it
grammar: だっけ indicates trying to recall something; から shows reason/cause; てくれ is a casual request

text: だからだから別にそんなつもりは
translation: So, so I didn't mean anything like that...
grammar: Repetition of だから shows nervousness; sentence trails off leaving thought incomplete

text: リツコさんが私の忘れたからって
translation: Because Ritsuko-san forgot mine...
grammar: からって combines から (because) with って (quoting); trailing って leaves thought incomplete

text: 本当なんだ / それでチャイム鳴らしても誰も出ないし / 鍵が開いてたんです / その… / あっ…
translation: It's true / And when I rang the bell, no one answered / The door was unlocked / Um... / Ah...
grammar: ても shows 'even though'; し adds reasons in sequence; んです emphasizes explanation; trailing ellipses show stammering

text: お疲
translation: You look tired / Good work

vocabulary.meaning: tired; short for お疲れ様 (good work, you must be tired)

grammar: Shortened greeting/acknowledgment, typically used after work or exertion

text: アイトさんに頼まれて
translation: I was asked by Ritsuko-san
grammar: Passive form with に marking the agent (the person who did the asking); te-form trails off

text: さっきはごめん / 何が?
translation: Sorry about earlier / About what?
grammar: は marks topic (the earlier event); が marks subject of question

text: あの、今日これから再起動の実験だよね
translation: Um, you have the reactivation experiment starting today, right?
grammar: だよね seeks confirmation (right?); の nominalizes the verb phrase into a noun

text: 今度はうまくいくといいね
translation: I hope it goes well this time
grammar: と after verbs indicates conditional/hypothetical; いいね expresses hope that something will be good

text: ねぇ、綾波は怖くないの?
translation: Hey, aren't you scared, Ayanami?
grammar: くない is negative form of i-adjectives; の adds questioning/seeking explanation tone

text: またあの0号機になるのが… / どうして?
translation: To get back in that Unit-00 again... / Why?

vocabulary.meaning: to ride, to board, to get in

grammar: のが nominalizes the verb phrase (the act of boarding); trailing が leaves thought incomplete

text: 前の実験で大怪我したんだって聞いたから、平気なのかなって思って…
translation: I heard you were seriously injured in the previous experiment, so I was wondering if you're really okay...
grammar: んだって is reported speech (I heard that); かなって思って expresses wondering/thinking; trailing ellipsis shows hesitation

text: あなた、碇司令の子供でしょ?
translation: You're Commander Ikari's child, aren't you?
grammar: でしょ is casual form of でしょう, seeking confirmation with light assertion

text: 信じられないの?お父さんの仕事は?
translation: You can't trust it? Your father's work?
grammar: られない is potential negative (cannot); の adds questioning tone

text: 当たり前だよ!あんな父親なんて!
translation: Of course I can't! A father like that!
grammar: なんて emphasizes negative feeling (a father like that!); exclamation shows emotional intensity

text: レイ、大丈夫か? / レイ
translation: Rei, are you okay? / Rei
grammar: か makes it a question; name repetition shows concern

text: その時 パイロットが中に閉じ込められてね / イカリ司令が彼女を助け出したね
translation: At that time, the pilot was trapped inside, you see / Commander Ikari rescued her
grammar: られて is passive form (was trapped); ね at end of sentences adds explanatory/narrative tone; を marks direct object

text: 加熱したハッチを 無理やりこじ開けてね / 手のひらの火傷はその時のものよ
translation: He forced open the heated hatch. The burn on his palm is from that time.

vocabulary.meaning: to pry open, to force open

grammar: ~てね at the end softens the statement. その時のもの means 'the one from that time'

text: レイ 聞こえるか
translation: Rei, can you hear me?

vocabulary.meaning: to be audible, to be heard

grammar: ~か at the end forms a yes/no question. 聞こえる is the potential form of 聞く

text: はい / 距離0号機の再起動実験を行う / 第一次接続開始
translation: Yes. / We will conduct the restart experiment for Unit 00. / Begin first connection.
grammar: ~を行う means 'to conduct/carry out'. 第一次 means 'first, primary'

text: 主電源コンタクト / 稼働電圧、輪回転を突破 / 了解 / フォーマットフェーズ2へ行こう
translation: Main power contact. / Operating voltage, breakthrough critical threshold. / Roger. / Let's proceed to format phase 2.
grammar: ~を突破 means 'to break through'. ~へ行こう means 'let's go to/proceed to'

text: パイロット、0号機と接続開始 / 回線開きます
translation: Pilot, beginning connection with Unit 00. / Opening circuit.
grammar: ~と means 'with'. ~を開きます is polite form of 'to open'

text: パルス予備ハーモニクス、正常 / シンクロ、問題なし、
translation: Pulse reserve harmonics, normal. / Synch, no problems.
grammar: ~なし means 'without, none'. Technical status report format is commonly noun + status

text: オルナーブリンク終了 / 再計算誤差修正なし
translation: All nerve link complete. / Recalculation error correction, none.
grammar: ~なし indicates absence or negation. Technical compound nouns are common in scientific contexts

text: チェック2590までリストクリア / 絶対境界線まであと2.5 / 1.7 / 1.2 / 1.0 / 0.8 / 0.6
translation: List clear up to check 2590. / To absolute borderline, 2.5 remaining... 1.7... 1.2... 1.0... 0.8... 0.6...
grammar: ~まで means 'up to, until'. あと means 'remaining, left'

text: 0.5 / 0.4 / 0.3 / 0.2 / 0.1 / 突破 / ボーダーラインクリア / 0号機起動しました
translation: 0.5... 0.4... 0.3... 0.2... 0.1... / Breakthrough! / Borderline cleared. / Unit 00 has been activated.
grammar: ~しました is past tense polite form indicating completed action

text: 了解
translation: Roger.
grammar: Standard military/technical acknowledgment term

text: はい。
translation: Yes.
grammar: Standard affirmative response

text: 再起動は成功した 戻れ
translation: The restart was successful. Return.
grammar: ~した is past tense. 戻れ is imperative form meaning 'return'

text: 目標はトーノサワ上空を通過 / 初号機発進準備に入ります
translation: Target is passing through airspace above Tonosawa. / Beginning launch preparations for Unit 01.
grammar: ~を通過 means 'to pass through'. ~に入ります means 'to enter into, begin'

text: 第1ロックボルト発電
translation: First lock bolt release.
grammar: Technical terminology for mechanical release systems

text: 解 / 除確認 / 了解 / 第2高速部発電 / 了軍 / 目標は足の子上空へ進入
translation: Release / confirmed. / Roger. / Second high-speed section release. / Roger. / Target entering airspace above Ashinoko.
grammar: ~へ進入 means 'entering into'. 了解/了軍 are acknowledgment terms

text: エヴァ初号機発進準備よろしい / 発進
translation: Eva Unit 01 launch preparations complete. / Launch!
grammar: よろしい indicates readiness or approval in formal contexts

text: 「目標
translation: Target...
grammar: Incomplete sentence indicating interrupted speech

text: シンジカン!
translation: Shinji-kun!
grammar: ~君 (kun) is an informal honorific used for boys or junior males

text: シンジは助かった / だがその傷は彼に甘え / た言葉を吐かす / 突き放すレイ
translation: Shinji was saved. But his wounds make him speak dependent words. Rei pushes him away.

vocabulary.meaning: to make say, to spit out

grammar: Preview/narration style. ~を吐かす is causative form 'to make (him) say'

text: 一方ミサトは首都に対し一点突破を試みる
translation: Meanwhile, Misato attempts a single-point breakthrough against the capital.
grammar: ~に対し means 'toward, against'. ~を試みる means 'to attempt'

text: 次回決戦第三新東京市
translation: Next episode: Decisive Battle, Third New Tokyo City.
grammar: Episode preview format: 次回 + title
